title: How to Change Your Email Password

steps.title: Log into the Gmail website using your Gmail account.
steps.content: Log into the Gmail website using your Gmail account. You can't change your Gmail password using the mobile app. If you are trying to reset your password because you can't access your account, click here .

steps.title: Click the Gear button and select "Settings".
steps.content: Click the Gear button and select "Settings".

steps.title: Click the "Accounts and Import" tab.
steps.content: Click the "Accounts and Import" tab.

steps.title: Click the "Change password" link.
steps.content: Click the "Change password" link.

steps.title: Enter your current password, and then enter your new password.
steps.content: Enter your current password, and then enter your new password. You will need to type it twice to confirm it. Click here for tips on creating a strong yet easy-to-remember password .

steps.title: Click "Change Password" to save your new password.
steps.content: Click "Change Password" to save your new password. [1] X Research source Your Gmail password is the same password for all of Google's products and services, including Drive, YouTube, and Hangouts. If you are logged into any Google services, such as on your mobile phone, you will be prompted to log in with your new password.

steps.title: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary).
steps.content: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary). If you're using Outlook or another email program to manage your Gmail account, you'll need to change the password in your account settings in Outlook. Click here for instructions .

steps.title: Log into the Yahoo!
steps.content: Log into the Yahoo! Mail website using your Yahoo! account. If you are trying to reset your password because you aren't able to get into your account, click here .

steps.title: Hover over the Gear button and select "Account Info".
steps.content: Hover over the Gear button and select "Account Info".

steps.title: Click the "Account security" tab on the left.
steps.content: Click the "Account security" tab on the left.

steps.title: Click "Change password".
steps.content: Click "Change password".

steps.title: Enter your new password.
steps.content: Enter your new password. You will need to type it twice to confirm it. Click here for tips on creating a strong yet easy-to-remember password .

steps.title: Click "Continue" to save your new password.
steps.content: Click "Continue" to save your new password. [2] X Research source Your Yahoo! Mail password is the same password for all other Yahoo! products, including Yahoo! Messenger and Yahoo! Finance.

steps.title: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary).
steps.content: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary). If you're using Outlook or another email program to manage your Yahoo! account, you'll need to change the password in your account settings in Outlook. Click here for instructions .

steps.title: Log into the Outlook.com website using your Microsoft or Hotmail account.
steps.content: Log into the Outlook.com website using your Microsoft or Hotmail account. Outlook.com is the new name for Hotmail. If you can't access your account because you don't remember your password, click here .

steps.title: Click your account name in the upper-right corner.
steps.content: Click your account name in the upper-right corner. This will often be your real name.

steps.title: Select "Account settings".
steps.content: Select "Account settings". You will be prompted to enter your password again.

steps.title: Click the "Change password" link in the "Security & privacy" section.
steps.content: Click the "Change password" link in the "Security & privacy" section.

steps.title: Select from the options on how to receive the "code".
steps.content: Select from the options on how to receive the "code". Click here for tips on creating a strong yet easy-to-remember password .

steps.title: Click on "Send Code".
steps.content: Click on "Send Code". [3] X Research source Your Outlook.com password is the same for all other products linked with that Microsoft Account. This can include Windows 8, Xbox Live, Skype, and more.

steps.title: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary).
steps.content: Adjust your mail client settings (if necessary). If you're using Outlook or another email program to manage your Outlook.com account, you'll need to change the password in your account settings in Outlook. Click here for instructions .
